text: There is always a reality where you need to find a job and it may not be what you want to do. Even though that is the case, I do think it is better to aim where you want to be and continuously work at where you ultimately want to end up.
Even if you take a job at a smaller house / company, if you are doing the type of job you ultimately want to do, you will be developing skills and building a portfolio
Plus also meeting people in that particular field that may end up helping you get future jobs
Looking back on my career, I would also say the following: it is better to not aim at a particular job title, but try to find the type of job and work that you enjoy doing day to day
Job titles will come and go, but if you enjoy actually doing your job that will keep motivating you throughout any job
